Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the Aesthetically Oriented The Pure is one of the ultra-chic hotels where everything is perfectly designed down to the smallest detail. In keeping with the name, the theme of the hotel is white: white chairs, white walls, white beds, and a white bar next to the reception counter.The hotel is a short walk from the main train station鈥攁bout two block from the lower level Poststrasse exit. The staff was congenial and professional.The room was very comfortable, and the bathroom was also very nice, although, like some other ultra-modern hotels, the shower took a couple minutes to figure out. The Internet had a wireless connection, which was included with the room. Instead of an old CRT TV, like those one finds all too often found in even the nicest hotels, the room had an LG LCD TV.Unfortunately, I had to leave for the airport too early to enjoy a breakfast, so I can't really comment on this one, but given the attention to detail that the hotel has shown in every other aspect, I suspect that the breakfast would have been good.It's a little expensive for business trip purposes, where the room is mainly a place you go to sleep, but it would be an excellent choice for a vacation or a romantic getaway.
Reviews.Author: popvoid

Reviews.Content: Would look elsewhere After reading the reviews I was really expecting something nice and fun. Wow what a disappointment. This place has a nice location but other than that really nothing special. My room was smallish and meagerly furnished. The staff was barely attentive and some what aloof. I did not get that wonderfully wicked vibe as others did. The hotel felt a little phony, I felt under server and somewhat taken by the price.
Reviews.Author: Lundeen

Reviews.Content: Smart and cool, central location       Balcony of my room at The Pure hotel
Reviews.Author: Lenzatti

Reviews.Content: Pure disappointment The Pure is conveniently located near the train station. Upon arrival I was offered a glass of champagne and check-in was efficient. The good things stop there. My room was on the ground floor behind the bar (literally). Nothing to shout about but noise in the evening and noise in the morning @ 6:30. Bathroom large but average. Overall this was a revamped storage area transformed into a room in my view. A real shame.
Reviews.Author: MCMember

Reviews.Content: Modern posh hotel with wonderful breakfast       The pure - hotel room balcony
Reviews.Author: spenjul

Reviews.Content: what a wicked place My wife and I stayed here for a weekend break and as soon as we arrived we were given welcome champagne and shown straight to our room (even though it was still 1000hrs).What ever you required was no problem for the extremely helpful staff, the room was airy and spacious and the cleanliness was second to none. We even saw the cleaner with a toothbrush cleaning the showers!.The location is 3-4 minutes from the main railway station and provides easy access to all of FrankfurtI would recommend this hotel for everyone. If I return to Frankfurt, this is where I will be staying.
Reviews.Author: svenwales

Reviews.Content: Great breakfast this is a very modern hotel, on a quiet street near to the main train station. the rooms are very comfortable and lap tops are available on loan from reception. Best of all is the lovely breakfast with a choice of fresh fruit and pastries, taken in the lobby lounge.
Reviews.Author: suzied

Reviews.Content: Hip hotel       very stylish seating in the rear of this small hotel
Reviews.Author: alisasha

Reviews.Content: Not for everybody The Good:1. Warm, helpful staff2. Bounteous, high-quality, delicious breakfast included3. High grade bedding and towels4. Clean, minimalist designThe Bad:1. Seedy neighborhood2. No food in hotel other than breakfast. Nearest full-service restaurant is a 10-minute walk3. Thin walls - could hear conversations and TV next door4. Lots of late night street noises on the weekend.5. Impractical room design. Examples - no outlet to plug in laptop at desk, full length mirror directly opposite toilet.I paid full price during the Frankfurt Gift Fair, and value is only so-so.
Reviews.Author: GiftBizGuy

Reviews.Content: Not bad, service is hit and miss though Stayed one night on business and was upgraded which was nice.The welcome drink was a great touch and the front desk were professional and quick.Room had an LCD TV hanging on the wall which is de rigeur these day in most design hotels. Bed had good quality linen and even though the room was on the 1st floor and the hotel was quite close to the station, it was relatively quiet.Robes were available but the sizing was all room. Ok if you are a petite size 8 female but not if are a male taller than 5ft 5 and weigh more than 10 stone. Although my room was on the first floor, I didn't seem to be able to pick up a wifi signal either.It would have been nice to be able to plug into an Ethernet point.In terms of location the hotel is not far from the city centre - about 15 minutes walk and very close to the station.Places to eat around the hotel are quite limited and there is no evening restaurant service either.
Reviews.Author: AngelosLondon

Reviews.Content: Great Service - Rooms basic I stayed two nights at the Pure on business. On check -in the staff were welcoming and efficient. They also helped to track down the mobile phone that I'd left in the taxi!The public areas are stylish with a minimalist / ambient feel. The bedrooms were similar but slightly too minimal. It could be me, but this has been done to death now; Give me some comfort any day. However, it was what was expected from the reviews you'll find here. Overall a better experience than the other hotels in the vicinity booked by my colleagues.
Reviews.Author: Clarkey99

Reviews.Content: The Coolest Place in Frankfurt       bar area
Reviews.Author: berlincity

Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel       Entrance
Reviews.Author: jarusoba

Reviews.Content: Tiny room, poor noise insulation The Pure is one of those look good hotels that fail to deliver on the basics of comfort. I stayed there while on a business trip for 1 night, at a rate of 鈧?60 for a single.The staff at the check in desk (which doubles as the bar) was helpful and efficient. I was given the keycard to room 401.My room had a single bed, and was not bigger than 15 square meters in total. A desk, a small wardrobe / cupboard, and a small bathroom with a small stand up shower only. Very basically appointed. The room was clean, and had a cool feeling, but the bed was not very comfortable, as it had no sheets, just a comforter, and the pillow was huge but uncomfortably large. The worse was that there seems to be nothing but a small sheet of wood between the rooms, and I could hear everything that went on in the next room and in the corridor.The lobby is ultra modern and very cool. The breakfast selection was also very good.However, I did not feel like this hotel combines coolness with the basics that a good hotel should have. I will not return.
Reviews.Author: AlbertR

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Great Hotel, very good staff. Great for downtown Frankfurt and a 5 minute walk to the Messe.I got a very good rate, last January, however the prices have increased quite a bit since my stay. Now about 鈧?50/night. Too expensive for me now.
Reviews.Author: TL28

Reviews.Content: Pure White       Mood Lighting in the Bathroom
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Watch your wallet! The Pure will take advantage of you...even with reservations! My family stayed at the Pure on 2 different parts of the same trip. There were 7 of us, so it was imperative that our reservations were confirmed before leaving the states. The 1st leg of the trip was great. They were accomodating to our group. The 2nd leg of the trip, they increased the amount of our stay by almost $2000.00USD!! We showed them a copy of our written confirmation as well as the series of emails between our party and the hotel, and they charged our card for MORE AFTER we left the COUNTRY! WATCH YOUR WALLET, because they will use your money to purchase more white items for their Purely unethical establishment!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hip does not mean luxury Stayed at the Pure as all other hotels seemed to be booked solid because of a trade fair. Hotel in itself is not bad (the area is though) but rooms are very very small and mine had a leaky shower curtain (they spend a fortune on bathroom fittings but use cheap curtains....). Overall not too comfortable. Hip breakfast as previously flagged. The experience cost me over 鈧?250 - twice what it's worth.
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta

Reviews.Content: Stylish but location not great Found this hotel on the design hotels web site and stayed due to decent rate offered - Euro 120 BB. Certainly good value at this rate. Location is 5 min walk from main railway station and 15 minute walk from Frankfurt Fair (Messe). Locality is not too salubrious, several moderate hotels and no restaurants to speak of, downtown is a 5 minute cab journey. Room very good, well designed and comfortable. Buffer breakfast very acceptable (never seen Absolut available for a morning pick-me-up Bloody Mary before!). Staff seemed keen to please though a general sense it was a little amateur on the service front. Decent work out machines in the (small) downstairs and also an excellent sauna and shower facility - though why no changing room! I reckon I was the only one brave enough to have tried out the sauna/shower facility on my visit. On reflection I'd stay again, so long as that competitive BB is still available.
Reviews.Author: leech_family

Reviews.Content: Stylish and Comfortable Originally chose this hotel for the close proximity to both the river and train station. Very impressed by the service from the moment we walked in and were even offered complementary drinks while we registered. As others have noted, the lobby / lounge resembles a very cool down-tempo club complete with couches. ambient music and strangely captivating videos. This area does double duty as the breakfast dining room offering a good variety of fresh pastries, blended fruit juices and cold meats. There's even a complementary bottle of vodka and shot glasses in the buffet!The rooms are compact, well decorated and very clean with high ceilings. The bathrooms are ample with large showers / baths and nice fluffy towels. Had a room on the third floor street side, but the street is very quiet and noise was not an issue. Some of the rooms are slightly larger than others so be sure to ask when you check-in. Staff service was excellent, discrete and very willing to help with transportation, restaurant and night life suggestions. I will definitely consider this hotel again the next time I am in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: Boh_1

Reviews.Content: There's more to a good design hotel than white everything! I'm writing this from my (fairly noisy) room in The Pure and my first piece of advice is don't let them put you in room 100. It's on the ground floor right next to the reception/bar area and although it's not throbbing with music you can hear people talking outside which isn't very relaxing. Things didn't go very well on arrival when the receptionist told me I had a single room despite the fact I was holding my confirmation clearly showing I had a double. She apologised and said there was one double left but didn't mention it was right next door to the bar. Apparently I can't change as there are no over rooms available.When I got into the room someone else's suitcase was in there which was removed but without explanation. Later, someone tried my doorhandle but thankfully didn't get in. Again, no explanation.The room itself is pleasant if a little sterile but it's very clean with a large bathroom and the free wifi is a plus. There's no restaurant at the hotel which wouldn't be a problem if it were possible to get some light snacks in the bar, but they don't offer any.Overall, I would say my experience so far has been disappointing. Service has been pretty mixed and I think too much effort has gone in to making The Pure ultra-modern at the expense of making a delightful, well thought out place to stay.
Reviews.Author: lhowland

Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel, a little more modern than I like What an interesting place, they lobby felt like a night club and the rooms felt the the milk bar from A Clockwork Orange. Very chic staff and we were probably the least fashionable people in the entire hotel. Overall the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Free internet access using their laptops was also a nice plus. The Pure had an excellent breakfast buffet and was located just down the street from the Bristol hotel, where were were originally going to stay. This hotel had just opened and I think we may have been the first people to ever stay in the room. It was a little more modern than I'm accustomed to, but all the facilities were great. Do take care with the shower curtain, it doesn't come quite the whole way down and it is easy to spray water all over the bathroom, as my wife found out. There was an excellent restaurant right across the street (I think called The Symposium) and we had a nice meal there. This hotel was close to the train station and a 25 euro cab ride from the airport. I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 椐呭墠銇畨鎵嬨伄銉涖儐銉€併仧銇犮仐鏈濋銇渶楂?#x201d;       閮ㄥ眿
